TITLE: Bitter cold eases, but new arctic blast is due soon
SUMMARY: There’s a brief pause in the winter freeze for some today — but a new arctic blast of cold air is due as early as tomorrow

TITLE: 9-year-old Florida boy killed after crawling under moving school bus
SUMMARY: Elyas Marshall Rodriguez had just gotten off at his stop when he ran back and crawled under the Orange County Public Schools bus, authorities said

TITLE: Dallas Cowboys make decision on Mike McCarthy's fate after historic playoff collapse
SUMMARY: The Cowboys were the first No. 2 seed to lose to the last team to get in since the 14-team format was adopted in 2020

TITLE: Michigan school board approves Mideast cease-fire resolution that had stoked controversy
SUMMARY: The resolution approved by the Ann Arbor Public Schools board appears to be among the first times that a public school system in the United States has made such a statement on the international conflict

TITLE: Florida GOP lawmakers seek to ban rainbow flags in schools, saying they’re bad for students
SUMMARY: State lawmakers have introduced more than a dozen anti-LGBTQ bills in Florida since the start of the year

TITLE: Massachusetts man sentenced to life with possibility of parole in racist road rage killing
SUMMARY: Dean Kapsalis, of Hudson, was convicted by a jury last year of second-degree murder, violation of constitutional rights and other offenses in the killing of Henry Tapia

TITLE: NBA player Josh Giddey won't face charges following allegations he had an inappropriate relationship with minor
SUMMARY: The Newport Beach Police Department said it was "unable to corroborate any criminal activity" and its investigation is closed

TITLE: Sophie Turner's lawsuit against Joe Jonas to return their children to the U.K. is dismissed
SUMMARY: Turner and Jonas had reached a child custody agreement in October, which was cited in the dismissal

TITLE: Suspect arrested in death of prominent N.Y. art dealer who was stabbed 18 times in Brazil
SUMMARY: Brent Sikkema, the co-owner of Sikkema Jenkins & Co., a well-known gallery in Manhattan, was found dead on Monday in his Rio de Janeiro apartment. He was 75

TITLE: Jay Leno files for conservatorship of his wife’s estate, petition says she has dementia
SUMMARY: The petition says his wife, Mavis Leno, is unable to execute an estate plan

TITLE: 80 years after the Holocaust, a genealogy test helped her find a cousin she never even knew was alive
SUMMARY: Ann Meddin Hellman found her cousin Shalom Koray and learned of his remarkable tale of survival, thanks to a DNA test from MyHeritage

TITLE: Taylor Swift’s name not searchable on X days after sexually explicit deepfakes go viral
SUMMARY: Whenever Swift’s name was typed into the search box on X, the message “Something went wrong. Try reloading” would appear

TITLE: U.S., U.K. among 9 countries pausing funding to UNRWA amid allegations 12 employees were part of Oct. 7 attack
SUMMARY: The United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East said it terminated the contracts of the people alleged to have participated in the incursion

TITLE: Maine town manager dies saving son, 4, after both fall through frozen pond
SUMMARY: Kevin Howell got his son out of the water but could not be found when his wife and first responders went looking for him, the county sheriff's office said

TITLE: 6 suffer minor injuries as American Airlines flight makes 'hard landing' in Maui
SUMMARY: American said a passenger and five flight attendants were treated for unspecified injuries and released. The flight was late when it left from Los Angeles

TITLE: Hiker found unresponsive at Utah's Zion National Park dies
SUMMARY: The 63-year-old man from San Diego appears to have experienced a heart attack, according to the National Park Service

TITLE: USA Hockey mandates neck protections for youths after a player died on the ice from skate cut
SUMMARY: The decision was announced three months after American Adam Johnson died after taking a skate blade to the neck during a game in the Elite Ice Hockey League

TITLE: Chiefs, 49ers in 2024 Super Bowl after Lions, Ravens losses: Highlights
SUMMARY: The Kansas City Chiefs won the AFC championship and the San Francisco 49ers took the victory in the NFC

TITLE: Philadelphia teen murder suspect who escaped en route to hospital is captured
SUMMARY: Shane Pryor was found by investigators boarding a public transit bus, authorities said

TITLE: Videos from night 13-year-old allegedly fatally stabbed mother show mom breastfeeding newborn, police arriving
SUMMARY: Derek Rosa, 13, was on the phone with a Hialeah, Florida, dispatcher asking: “I see officers. I see officers. Do I leave my house

TITLE: Fungus that sparked deadly meningitis outbreak aggressively attacked the brainstem
SUMMARY: A new report details the cases of 13 patients who were infected last year at two surgery clinics in Mexico

TITLE: CDC report finds teens are using drugs — often alone — to ease anxiety or 'forget bad memories'
SUMMARY: Nearly half of surveyed teens said they turned to drugs to "stop worrying about a problem or forget bad memories

TITLE: Two men say they were each robbed of over $30,000 after going to the same bar on different nights
SUMMARY: The men went to a sports bar in Atlanta's Buckhead neighborhood this year and last

TITLE: Utah official faces calls to resign after falsely suggesting teen girl is transgender
SUMMARY: Gov. Spencer Cox denounced the official, Utah State School Board member Natalie Cline, saying she has embarrassed the state

TITLE: Trader Joe’s recalls food items with cotija cheese for potential listeria contamination
SUMMARY: The cheese items could potentially be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes

TITLE: Kansas City police investigating after video appears to show Black woman called ‘animal’ during arrest
SUMMARY: The arrest followed what police called a “disturbance” with staff at a restaurant, and police said a review is underway

TITLE: Nebraska police officer fatally shoots teen during welfare check
SUMMARY: Police were responding to reports of potential self-harm when an officer shot and killed a 17-year-old boy

TITLE: A N.J. town has 24 officers. A fourth of them are suing the borough.
SUMMARY: The mayor of Spotswood has asked the state’s attorney general to step in after officers filed multiple lawsuits alleging bullying, discrimination and retaliation

TITLE: At least 6 people are missing after a house fire and shooting in Pennsylvania
SUMMARY: "There’s nobody alive in that house right now," the Delaware County DA said, and a recovery operation is underway

TITLE: BAFTA will honor Matthew Perry at Television Awards after omission from In Memoriam sparks backlash
SUMMARY: "Matthew Perry will be remembered in our forthcoming BAFTA Television Awards in May 2024," a BAFTA spokesperson said

TITLE: U.S. funding delay could create opening for China, Pacific Island nations warn
SUMMARY: The budget impasse in Congress has further delayed crucial funding for Palau, the Marshall Islands and the Federated States of Micronesia, which are also being courted by China

TITLE: Inside the making of Tom Hanks and Steven Spielberg’s ‘Masters of the Air’
SUMMARY: The Apple TV+ limited series starring Austin Butler and Callum Turner was a yearslong undertaking to bring the stories of World War II airmen to life

TITLE: Measles infections pose far more risks than most realize, including a fatal neurological complication
SUMMARY: The virus can cause “immune amnesia,” leaving patients more vulnerable to other infections

TITLE: Neo-Nazis march in Nashville, leave after being challenged
SUMMARY: The group left in a U-Haul box truck that was driven out of the county, police said, indicating the demonstrators were outsiders

TITLE: At least 1 dead, 5 injured in shooting at Indianapolis Waffle House
SUMMARY: Homicide detectives believe the incident started with "a disturbance between two groups that escalated to gunfire

TITLE: American man admits to attacking 2 U.S. tourists and killing one of them near a German castle
SUMMARY: Authorities say the women didn’t know the man before they met near Neuschwanstein. The suspect was arrested shortly after the June 14 attack

TITLE: High levels of this B vitamin may increase risk of heart disease, new research suggests
SUMMARY: Excess amounts of vitamin B3 — which is found in meat, fish, nuts, and fortified cereals and breads — may trigger inflammation and damage blood vessels

TITLE: New York Archdiocese denounces funeral of trans activist and actor Cecilia Gentili
SUMMARY: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York condemned the funeral of Cecilia, which was held in St. Patrick’s Cathedral in Manhattan and drew a large audience on Thursday

TITLE: Two childhood best friends separated by the India-Pakistan partition reunite in viral TikTok
SUMMARY: Separated in 1947 by the subcontinent’s division, a 90 and 89-year-old are recovering a decades-old bond

TITLE: GM expands North America recall for potentially faulty tailgates to 820,000 trucks
SUMMARY: Newer Chevy Silverados and GMC Sierras may be affected

TITLE: FBI raids 2 homes owned by NYC Mayor Eric Adams' Asian Affairs director
SUMMARY: FBI agents carried out morning raids at two Bronx addresses, which records show are owned by Winnie Greco, a former fundraiser for Adams who now serves as his director of Asian affairs

TITLE: New York AG sends county lawmaker a cease-and-desist letter over trans athlete ban
SUMMARY: Attorney General Letitia James ordered a Nassau County executive to “immediately rescind” an order designed to keep transgender athletes from playing sports

TITLE: Texas wildfires: 500 structures destroyed, governor says
SUMMARY: The Smokehouse Creek Fire is already the biggest in Texas history and has spread into Oklahoma

TITLE: Missing 13-year-old Florida girl found dead and mother's boyfriend suspected of moving her body
SUMMARY: Video evidence showed Stephan Sterns, the boyfriend of Madeline Soto's mother, discarding items in a dumpster the day she vanished, police said. Her backpack and laptop were later found inside

TITLE: This L.A. neighborhood's 'cool pavements' help it beat the intense heat
SUMMARY: A solar-reflective coating used in the community of Pacoima could be a playbook to offer relief to other incredibly warm — and often working-class — California neighborhoods

TITLE: Does yogurt reduce risk of diabetes? The FDA says it might.
SUMMARY: Food makers can safely advertise that eating yogurt may reduce the risk of Type 2 diabetes, the FDA announced on Friday — with some caveats

TITLE: Ohio 'incel' who plotted to kill women at college is sentenced to 6 years in prison
SUMMARY: Tres Genco, 24, pleaded guilty to attempting to commit a hate crime. He wrote that he would act “out of hatred, jealousy and revenge,” prosecutors said
